item.title: What is SAML? Understanding Security Assertion Markup Language
item.description:
Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) is an open standard that allows secure exchange of authentication and authorization data between partiesâ€”primarily between an identity provider (IdP) and a service provider (SP).

In simple terms, SAML enables Single Sign-On (SSO). That means users can log in once (to the identity provider) and then gain access to multiple systems or applications (the service providers) without logging in again.
